snippet: One of the nation’s most influential groups of engineers said it presented detailed warnings that a devastating storm surge in the region was all but inevitable and proposed ways to prepare.
abstract: American Society of Civil Engineers says it presented detailed warnings in 2009 that a devastating storm surge in the New York City region was all but inevitable, along with suggestions for preparation; some members see parallels to alarms that went unheeded before Hurricane Katrina struck New Orleans in 2005.

byline.original: By JAMES GLANZ and MIREYA NAVARRO

lead_paragraph: One of the nation’s most influential groups of engineers said it presented detailed warnings that a devastating storm surge in the region was all but inevitable and proposed ways to prepare.

headline.seo: In 2009, Engineers Detailed Storm Surge Threat to New York City
headline.main: Engineers’ Warnings in 2009 Detailed Storm Surge Threat to the Region
headline.print_headline: Engineers’ Warnings in 2009 Detailed Storm Surge Threat to the Region
